channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Not enough bins for residents. Constantly overflowing, 29th June
item.description:
X2 bins for x21 flats. Bins always overflowing into communal refuse space. Rubbish smell seeps into residential building, common foyer, corridors and private flats. Smells terrible. Building management refuse to accept smell or deal with issue.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Powell Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: New paper and cardboard bins in Penge East car Park are overflowing, 29th June
item.description:
New Silver paper and cardboard bins in Penge East car Park are overflowing And serve no purpose where they were placed. These new silver bins are new. probably the council thought to place them here to help people not flytip. However they seem to be defeating the objects as as you can see from the photos, people are not actually using the green recycling banks and anymore and rather filling these new bins up, overflowing them and then flytipping the rest of their recycling on the ground. The situation was much better when we only had the green recycling banks. The new silver bins are blocking a free space to use the green recycling banks and making the space tight for someone to stand up to use the green recycling banks without tripping. The new silver bins are a real tripping hazard. This site should be clear at all times according to the council’s code of practice. Could you please arrange to remove these new silver bins as soon as possible. The residents were not consulted about placing them and we will have to seek legal action against the council if they are removed immediately. By placing these new bins here the council is allowing for more flytipping and being part of it. They are simply not helping but rather making the site look like a dumpster.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Station Road, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Numerous cars parked illegally on road, 29th June
item.description:
There are a number of cars that repeatedly park illegally on the west parkside road next to the Souther Park in North Greenwich area - they are parked on double yellow lines (at present there are 12 cars parked there). This problem has been persistent for about 6-9 months now (since the social housing building adjacent to the road started operating). But gets worse and worse every day It is becoming more hazardous by the day as more cars park there and it is extremely difficult to see the road when crossing as a pedestrian. The fines seems to be ignored (when they are placed on cars), something more fundamental needs to be done to prevent the parking there. Some kind of blocks to parking or clamping/towing should be implemented.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 35, West Parkside, East Greenwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter & Dog Waste bin overflowing & smelly, 29th June

item.title: 3x this week someone allowing dog fouling, 29th June
item.description:

item.title: Dead fox on the barrier on Bromze age way, 29th June
item.description:
There is a dead fox on Bronze Age Way. It is on the edge of the road, next to the barrier, the central reservation. It is on the side of the road that goes from the fish to the horse
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bronze Age Way, Northumberland Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Brambles and tree growth on the footpath, 29th June
item.description:
Reported previously; report closed as "fixed" but nothing was done. All around this light column and next to the big oak tree brambles, nettles and tree growth are spilling to the narrowest part of the footpath used by thousands of schoolchildren and residents everyday. They scratch all passersby and make them step on the very busy road. Need to be resolved properly so that the footpath is back to its normal width (which isn't wide enough TBH)
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Logs Hill, Elmstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Two stumps are still there, not replaced by new trees as promised, 29th June
item.description:
